title: Vita: The Life of Vita Sackville-West
description: The Hon Victoria Mary Sackville-West, Lady Nicolson, CH (9 March 1892 â€“ 2 June 1962), best known as Vita Sackville-West, was an English author, poet and gardener. She won the Hawthornden Prize in 1927 and 1933. She was known for her exuberant aristocratic life, her passionate affair with the novelist Virginia Woolf, and Sissinghurst Castle Garden, which she and her husband, Sir Harold Nicolson, created at their estate. This is her biography.
author: Victoria Glendinning
